content: Who painted the famous 1930 masterpiece "American Gothic", which depicts a farmer standing beside his daughter?

The famous 1930 painting "American Gothic" was created by Grant Wood, an American artist known for his contributions to the Regionalism art movement. The painting portrays a stern-looking farmer standing beside a woman, who was initially thought to be his wife but is actually his daughter. The subjects are posed in front of a Victorian Gothic-style house, which serves as a backdrop for the composition. This iconic artwork has become synonymous with American culture and continues to captivate audiences worldwide with its depiction of rural life and its enigmatic characters.
